page.title: 13Leigh Bakery
page.content: Number 17, Broadway West is a bakery. It sells cakes and bread and has a picnic bar. The first owner was Mr Offord. The story goes that the shop used to be a drapers. One day Mr Offord's daughter brought some cakes to the shop. They sold so well that Mr Offord turned it into a baker's shop. The manager, Mr Flanagan, showed us round. He has owned it since 1971. He has 4 other bakeries and a butcher's shop. He employs 50 people and 14 work in the bakery. Opening hours are 8am-5pm. It is closed half day Wednesday, all day Sunday and Saturday is the busiest day of the week. There is a silo which holds 12\ tons of flour. The tanker that fills the silo can hold 20 tons. It takes about 20 minutes to fill the silo. When it is full a warning bell rings and the driver removes the pipes. (cont'd)
